Record.ClassificationPath: Chemicals_and_Drugs_Kind/Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material/Dietary Supplement/Vitamin E Acetate/d-Alpha-Tocopherol Acetate
Chemicals_and_Drugs_Kind/Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material/Dietary Supplement/d-Alpha-Tocopherol Succinate
Chemicals_and_Drugs_Kind/Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material/Food or Food Substance/Food Component/Bioactive Food Component/Tocopherol/Alpha-Tocopherol/d-Alpha-Tocopherol
Record.BroaderTerm: Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material
Record.Description: A naturally-occurring form of vitamin E, a fat-soluble vitamin with potent antioxidant properties. Considered essential for the stabilization of biological membranes (especially those with high amounts of polyunsaturated fatty acids), d-alpha-Tocopherol is a potent peroxyl radical scavenger and inhibits noncompetitively cyclooxygenase activity in many tissues, resulting in a decrease in prostaglandin production. Vitamin E also inhibits angiogenesis and tumor dormancy through suppressing vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) gene transcription. (NCI04)
